An interview with Gila Gamliel, the Israeli Minister of Intelligence
entry.content:
Gila Gamliel is an Israeli politician who currently serves as the Minister of Intelligence and as a member of the Knesset for Likud. She also previously served as Minister for Social Equality and as Minister of Environmental Protection.

I conducted an interview with her for At Magazine. 

Title: Gila Gamliel is afraid of the day when the "The Handmaid's Tale" will become a reality in Israel

For the full interview: https://www.atmag.co.il/%d7%92%d7%99%d7%9c%d7%94-%d7%92%d7%9e%d7%9c%d7%99%d7%90%d7%9c-%d7%a8%d7%99%d7%90%d7%99%d7%95%d7%9f/

link.title: An interview with Gila Gamliel, the Israeli Minister of Intelligence

entry.title: Karim Rashid's Utopia
entry.content:
An interview I conducted for "At" magazine with Egyptian industrial designer, Karim Rashid.

Title: Karim Rashid's Utopia

He sees Trump as the symbol of evil, but he would be happy to redesign the White House for him. With the opening of the Polyhouse hotel he designed in Tel Aviv, Nim Dvir met Karim Rashid for an interview about a bright future for design

For the full article: https://www.atmag.co.il/%d7%a8%d7%99%d7%90%d7%99%d7%95%d7%9f-%d7%a2%d7%9d-%d7%a7%d7%90%d7%a8%d7%99%d7%9d-%d7%a8%d7%90%d7%a9%d7%99%d7%93/

entry.title: Sandra Oh and Jodie Comer
entry.content:
An interview I wrote for "Israel Hayom" 


Enemies, A Love Story: An Interview with 

Sandra Oh and Jodie Comer

 

What made the television critics state that "Killing Eve" is a perfect series? How did Jodie Comer become a fashion icon thanks to the character of a psychopathic killer? And will the success settle Sandra for the role of James Bond? With the return of the crime drama for a second season, Nim Dvir met the stars and came back with a rebuke

Full article (in Hebrew):  https://www.israelhayom.co.il/magazine/shishabat/article/9324631

entry.title: Julia Louis Dreyfus
entry.content:
An interview I did with  Julia Louis-Dreyfus on the set of Veep. 


Title: I returned. 

Description: Two years have passed since I was diagnosed with breast cancer by Julia Louis-Dreyfus. She shared her healing process with her followers, while simultaneously filming the final season of "Veep." In an interview with "Shishavet," she speaks about the connection between comedy and politics and admits: "To be a woman at a certain age trying to remain relevant and influential."

Full article: https://www.israelhayom.co.il/article/645081

entry.title: Interview ✯ Edie Falco
entry.content:
Interviewing actress Edie Falco was an uplifting experience. I was inspired by her devotion, commitment, modesty and mainly by the fact she gained recognition relatively late in her career (yet didn't lose hope). 

 I like her a lot as an actress, so it nice to learn she also has such a positive personality.

The interview I did with Edie Falco on Ynet

A TV review I wrote about Falco's show, "Nurse Jackie"

entry.title: Experience ✩ Vipassana
entry.content:
I went to a Vipassana retreat to heal my soul.

As it often happens, I ended up writing about the experience in a personal column published both in www.Xnet.co.il and in "Pnai Plus" magazine. It's titled: 
  • "Natural High": Nim Dvir's experience in a Vipassana retreat
For 10 days I didn't speak, didn't use a cell phone, didn't go online, didn't create eye contact with ANYONE (!), ate only vegan food and most importantly - meditated for about 14 hours a day. 

Like the headline suggests, it was much like being high, spending days feeling disconnected, dazed and surprisingly serene. 


 There's a lot to say and reflect (like I've tried to do in my text), but to summarize: It was one of the best, most meaningful experiences I ever had.

  • My photo album from the retreat (it wasn't allowed to take pictures, of course, but I managed to sneak a few) 
  • This is were I've been: The Vipassana Meditation Center – Dhamma Dharā – located in in Shelburne, Massachusetts
  • If you wish to read more about Vipassana, I recommend starting here
entry.georss:featurename: Vipassana Meditation Center, 386 Colrain Shelburne Road, Shelburne Falls, MA 01370, USA

entry.title: Interview ✭ Jennifer Lopez (PETA Protest and Fighting Over Fur)
entry.content:
Jennifer Lopez LOVES fur. 

She loves it so much, that she was willing to almost start fighting over it in the middle of our interview. The conversation was originally planned to be about her acting career, being fabulous, the usual. 


Unfortunately (for her), PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals) activists were waiting outside where we've met, protesting loudly against Lopez's obsession with wearing things that used to have a pulse. They even tried at some point to spray me with fake blood (!!!) as I was going in. From that moment on it was obvious that this interview is going to get, well, bloody. 
  • My bloody interview with Jennifer Lopez on Ynet

link.title: Interview ✭ Jennifer Lopez (PETA Protest and Fighting Over Fur)

entry.title: Special Interview ★ Jim Carrey
entry.content:
I consider my interview I had with actor Jim Carrey as one of the most meaningful I had during my (long) period as a culture correspondent. It took me a while to understand this, but during our short encounter Carrey managed to teach me a valuable lesson about respect, understanding and even a touch of enlightenment. No joke. 

While I was expecting to meet a comedian with a penchant for extreme facial expression, Carrey surprised me when he came equiped with serious, almost gloomy, political and social agenda. For example, during the interview he called the American economy "A rotten Apple", Compared corporate CEOs to Roman emperors (and called them "vulgar") and gave this unforgettable quote when he was asked what's his current goal: 

"I just want to be so clear that I would turn into a ball of light and would fly off the planet"

Back then, I thought he lost it. It took me a long time until I realized that the it wasn't Carrey who weren't logical; It was me who didn't understand him. Only after doing some reading and learning of my own I was able to comprehend what Carrey was talking about. Since then, I went back a few times to our talk, discovering insights that were out of my reach at the time we met. The lesson I've learned is not to quickly label people when I don't understand their meaning. Instead, I question myself, staying alert for hidden lessons and learning opportunities. 

P.S 

I think that I want to turn into a ball of light too. Maybe. 

My interview with Jim Carrey on Ynet

entry.title: Game of Thrones
Interview ✪ Darren Star at the US Ambassador's House
entry.content:
Darren Star has left a substantial mark on my TV education (or miseducation, depends who you're asking).

This is the man who provided us with the pop classics Beverly Hills 90210, Melrose Place and Sex and the City which blended to perfection attractive singles, big hair, good teeth, DRAMA and over-priced NYC/ LA zip codes (aka, his signature mix).

More than anything else, Star's secret recipe was to capture the essence of the time, And it worked: for most of the time of the 90's-early 2000's Star's babies were the soundtracks and screensavers of our lives, feeding us juicy and digestible sugary stories that were digested to nostalgic cultural memorabilia. 

Armed with so much admiration, it's easy to understand why I was excited to finally meet him face to face in a very appropriate setting: a party that was held in his honor at the house / mansion of the United States Ambassador to Israel. 

Or, My lovely date and friend, and I had a three main goals for the night: 

1. Get Star to sign our Vintage Brenda Walsh Beverly Hills 90210 trading cards.
2. Eat as much of the ambassadorial food as possible, including Double Dip.
3. Become BFF's with star and hear behind the scenes secrets.


I'm happy to report that we've accomplish our goals and got to chat with our childhood hero about Brandon and Dylan, what he watches for fun and the next big hit. We also got to embarrass ourselves several times and to take pictures with random art (that belongs to the ambassador). Fun.


Click here for my interview with Darren Star and coverage of the Ambassador's party (including video)

Doing It American Style: more pics from our night at the diplomatic party are on my Facebook album "We Are Royal"

link.title: Interview ✪ Darren Star at the US Ambassador's House

entry.title: Video Interview ✰ "I, Frankenstein"
entry.content:
Not too often do I get to create an exclusive integrated video for a website (and not television). Especially when cooperating with a multi-million dollar budget blockbuster. Luckily, I got a chance to do it for Ynet.co.il with the help of the new action film "I, Frankenstein".

The core part of making the video was interviewing the cast of the film, headed by Aaron Eckhart and Yvonne Strahovski, at the swanky Ritz-Caralton hotel in NYC's Battery park.




I'm not sure that it's visible just how much fun I had during these interviews (especially since much of the more sassy footage was left on the cutting room floor). It was a blast. Honestly, it's pretty funny to try and discuss seriously a film that's based around the WTF idea of giving Mary Shelley's Frankenstein a makeover, turning him into.. a hunky superhero.

Yeah, some scenes are pretty impressive visually, but story-wise? it's.. well.. ridiculous. How bad? Let's just say that when I watched it, the crowd in the theater couldn't stop laughing, hardcore, Unfortunately always during scenes that were meant to be serious / smart. Awkward.
Eckhart, aka shirtless "Adam" (that's the film's new hip name for Victor Frankenstein's creation) tried discussing the "depth" of his character. Strahovski, aka a way-too-young scientist of... Something, attempted to analyze the "dramatic" relationship between her character and Frankie, ah.. Adam. They obviously failed. It was clear to EVERYONE in the room, including even the flowers on the table, that there are no depth, drama or even common sense behind this thing. And that's what made these interviews so funny. Nothing like attempting to explore issues like "Frankenstein as a sex symbol - Yay or Nay" while trying to keep a straight face :)

Here is the link to my original article + video interviews with the stars of "I, Frankenstein"


Looks similar?

entry.title: Participatory Reporting ✫ Hot Nude Yoga
entry.content:
When I had my weekly column about living and loving in NYC ("America"), I had to come up every week with something cool to write about. It was a challenge, but it also forced me to venture outside of my comfort zone in search for writing ideas. 

A classic example is the column I wrote about "Hot Nude Yoga", a yoga studio in Chelsea where you get into positions sans clothing. Since my regular style was participatory reporting / gonzo, there was no doubt that I have to give it a try myself. 

The result is one of the funniest columns I ever wrote, at least in my opinion. Testicles, rectums, penises... Everything is there. Classy (but hilarious).  

I'm taking it all off and reporting from a "Hot Naked Yoga" session

entry.title: Annual List My "20 Most Beautiful People"
Interview ✫ Clive Owen
entry.content:
An interview I did with actor Clive Owen for "Pnai Plus" magazine. Haven't decided yet if he's a sex symbol or not (either way he was very nice).

- My interview with Clive Owen on Ynet

entry.title: Interview ★ Julianne Moore
entry.content:
I think actress Julianne Moore is gorgeous. She is also very talented, most of the times (my personal favorite is her portrayal of Sarah Palin on "Game Change").

The reason I say "most of the times" is because that like every other human being, Moore has her off moments as well. Especially, when there's no good director around to stop her from crying hysterically and being too emotional (her signature style).

Well, apparently Moore doesn't like to joke about it. In fact, she almost tore my head off during an interview for "Pnai Plus" magazine when I asked her why she likes so much to play women in distress. Hmm, she didn't take it well and will therefore forever be remembered as one of the celebrities who almost killed me during an interview. There are more, of course. Love it.

- My interview with Julianne Moore (Pnai Plus magazine / Ynet)

entry.title: Concert Review ✰ Rihanna (+Bonus Surprise)
entry.content:
There is a general agreement among (some) culture critics that Rihanna usually suck in concerts. especially if they're in Israel.

It's cool that Rihanna puts Israel on her traveling itinerary. So far, she brought two of her tours to Tel Aviv (right? at least as far as I remember). The bad part is that RiRi have so much fun in the Holiland, like spending time touring old Jerusalem and floating the Dead Sea (for real, check her Instagram), so she sometimes forget other small obligations like rehearsing. The result is that so far all of R's concerts in Israel were declared as fiascoes and generated massive uproars, like a call to boycott her or even a group of disappointed fans that tried (and obviously failed) to organize a lawsuit against the lady.

It's a shame, since Rihanna is huge there and she pretty much only need to cough something to top local charts. Actually, I remember that personally I had a pretty good time at her concert (I went to the first one, the "Rated R" tour). She was indeed boring, out of tune and not performing mega hits for that times. I called my review "Disturbia", like one of her hits. But... who am I kidding, really? I was at a free concert with all my friends, enjoying complementary perks like a VIP area and free drinks. 

So, I can't deny I had fun. Still, seriously, Rihanna, what's up gurl? Get your act together, Tel Aviv deserved more TLC (or at least some good songs here and there). 

Here is my review on NRG:

Disturbia: Review of Rihanna's "Rated R" Concert in Tel Aviv

more good stuff ahead...






Bonus! Here are some personal pics I took at the concert. More pics are up on my Facebook Rihanna album.

entry.title: Interview (*2) ✯ Amiram Eini
entry.content:
Male model Amiram Eini is such a big deal that one interview wasn't enough. He needed two.
Seriously, I'm not sure exactly how it happened, but the bottom line is that I got to interview Eini twice in a short period of time, once for Yedioth Aharonot and once for the competition, Ma'ariv.

Both interview are pretty similar and revolves around Eini's story of mega successful supermodel (check out his campaigns in the articles) and how towards the end of his 30's he decided to pick up a guitar and become a singer. Don't worry, though, he's still campaigning here and there, just enough to allow him long periods of time to work on his musical passion. After two interviews I can conclude - no one has an ideal life, but this dude has it pretty close.

Interview 1 with Amiram Eini on Ynet

Interview 2 with Amiram Eini on NRG

entry.title: Interview ★ Patti Stanger
entry.content:
Do you remember Patti Stanger, A.K.A, "The Millionaire Matchmaker"?

I got to interview this sassy TV personality, who made a career finding love to the rich and loaded on reality TV (Bravo). We had a nice conversation about love, money and Judaism. Unfortunetly, while she did ask me to reffar potential clients to her agency, she didn't find me my own Millionaire soulmate. Shame.

My interview with Patti Stanger for Pnai Plus magazine / Ynet

http://www.ynet.co.il/articles/0,7340,L-3739132,00.html

entry.title: Breaking News Amy Winehouse found dead
Doggy Journalism Finding a Coat for Dima Diamond
Opinion Column Young Girls and Reality TV
Behind the Scenes Coverage New York Fashion Week
Interview ★ Lady Gaga
entry.content:
It's pretty strange to think of it now, but Lady Gaga and I were classmates, starting NYU (New York University) as part of the same class. Gaga, then known more as Stefani Germanotta, has managed to become since then a pop icon and a world phenomena. Almost like me, just a little better.

Just before she came to perform in Tel-Aviv, Israel, I had a candid conversation with the Gaga about our school days, glam living, her "kids", secret for success and what she's doing with all that money.

✴ Click here for my full interview with Lady Gaga (Ynet)

entry.title: Interview ✭ Khloe Kardashian
entry.content:
I knew it was a matter of time until I'll get to interview Khloe Kardashian, the sassiest member of the Kardashians and the sister formerly known as "The Ugly One". Well, not anymore: Khloe has long been a media darling and a very good cover model (a few examples attached).

In our interview Khloe started by telling me that she loves me (!) and continued with a warm conversation. To my surprise, she later complained to the PR people that she didn't like my tone and felt like "I was making fun of her", which is obviously not true. I guess back-stabbing and scheming carry on even when the reality cameras are off.

✪ Click here for my interview with  Khloe Kardashian (Ynet)

entry.title: Interview ✫ Michael Fassbender
entry.content:
I was lucky to lend an interview with  Michael Fassbender about his new (and third) collaboration with director Steve McQueen, "12 Years a Slave".

I personally thought the film was phenomenal. Fassbender himself turned out to a very intelligent thinker. I was impressed.

★ Read the full interview with Michael Fassbender here

entry.title: Interview ✯ Anjelica Huston
entry.content:
Another souvenir from my visit to the set of "Smash": An interview I had with Anjelica Huston
that was published in "La'Isha" (which literally means in Hebrew "For the Woman"), which is the leading and biggest women magazine in Israel. Respect!

entry.title: Set Visit ✯ Behind the Scenes of the Musical TV Show "SMASH"
entry.content:
There's no justice in the world! Until I find a real shiny, happy, trashy and sweet guilty pleasure - the musical show "Smash" - a bunch of TV executives decided to cancel it. Without asking me. So rude!

I love, I mean "loved", "Smash". It wasn't the smartest kid on the block but it was pretty, fun and with good intentions. Enough to win my heart.


Luckily, before it got canceled I got a chance to visit the set of the second season, located in Brooklyn, and to have a bubbly interview with its two main stars - Katharine McPhee and Megan Hilty.

Here is the "Ynet" interview with the two gorgeous ladies. I don't usually loose my cool but Katharine McPhee took my breath away. She is so talented! hope "Smash" is just the beginning of her career.

link.title: Set Visit ✯ Behind the Scenes of the Musical TV Show "SMASH"

entry.title: An Interview ✯ Ryan Gosling
entry.content:
Ryan Gosling, in my view, is a classic example of over-hype. He's a cute guy, decent actor and semi-attractive (in some angles and good lighting). But... I think the media craziness about this dude totally ruins his game. For some reason, the tabloids started worshiping his anus, giving him titles like "the sexiest man alive". Pa-lease.

Anyway, I've interviewed Gosling recently about his latest film, "The Place Beyond the Pines". We met in New York (Waldorf Astoria hotel, love it) and he was OK. That's it. Not a god, not a sex symbol, for sure not the sexiest diamond Mother Earth ever gave her children. Just a regular dude that is suffocating from too much buzz. It looks like he feels the choke too, since during the interview he stated that he's not going to take off his shirt onscreen anymore. Is there a right for love and life without a shirtless Gosling? We'll have to wait and see.


★ Here is the full interview for "Ynet" I did with Ryan Gosling (including a funny connection to Israeli crime history)


★ Direct link: http://www.ynet.co.il/articles/0,7340,L-4361635,00.html



.

entry.title: Set Visit ✯ Shooting Gay Porn with Michal Lucas
entry.content:
In a retro state of mind, I feel like re-posting one of my favorite video articles: going behind the scenes of "Inside Israel", a gay porn movie shot in Israel. In this video, I'm trying to keep a straight face (pun intended) while the guys are humping behind me.

- CLICK HERE FOR THE ARTICLE ON YNET

The man responsible to this whole shenanigan is Michael Lucas, a personal friend and a very talented director, producer and actor. Check out his entertainment empire on his official website - www.lucasentertainment.com

Steve Buscemi is an ugly man. I'm sorry, but he is. When I interviewed him for the new season of "Boardwalk Empire" I couldn't stop thinking of how ugly he is. Here is the entire article, where I mainly talk about the way he looks:

entry.title: Set Visit ✰ Homeland
entry.content:
For the new season of "Homeland" I flew to Charlotte, North Carolina, and spent a few days on the set with Abu-Nazir, Claire Danes and all the gang. the full story is here.
✯ Behind the scenes: "Homeland"
What I didn't mention there was that in the hotel I ate this ice cream thingy wrapped with cookies and it was the most delicious dessert I had in my life. That is all.

entry.title: Going Viral ★ Sacha Baron Cohen
entry.content:
A few weeks ago, I had some crazy times thanks to Sacha Baron Cohen, or as he is known now by his alter ago, "The Dictator״.


I met Cohen at a press conference he held as the notorious dictator in the "Waldorf Astoria" hotel in New York City. After lots of gimmicks (Cohen entered with an armed entourage of beautiful female bodyguards, a fake demonstration in his honor was held), Cohen took questions from the many journalists in the room. The problem was that it was all planned! Everything was scripted.


Luckily, at the very end of the press conference I got to grab the microphone, very last secondly. And then

this happened: (there are other angles of the incident)


It was funny, but at the time I couldn't imagine the global attention it exploded to. There were items about our "sexual" rendezvous everywhere, like this one on "Entertainment Weekly״ (it's in the headline!) Or "New York Magazine" Or the Israeli Ynet that even put our pictures (love you, Ynet). It was also on E! News, Playboy and everywhere.

 

Crazy! I have to say that it was of the more exciting weeks of my life and made me admit proud and loudly that (little) good fame and publicity are fun things.

 

The full article (plus video) as was brodcasted on "Erev Tov with Guy Pines")

 

Entertainment Weekly giving respect

 

I Love New York Magazine

 

Ynet publishes pictures too

 

My brother's ("Varig in London") take on it

 

And the Dictator? He didn't call, but he did send me a gold watch, like a true old school leader. No joke.

entry.title: Interview ✪ Michael Lewis is Boiling!
entry.content:
The Israeli model/ actor Michael Lewis, now living and loving in New York, came to my place for an Interview to "Pnai Plus" magazine. The hot cover picture is above and here is the full interview with Michael Lewis we did during our night together.

✪ He turned out to be a cool and smart guy. The abs are just another advantage (how do I get those? shit).

Here he is posing at my living room with the real male super model of Israel, Dima Diamond Dvir.

Here's another hot picture, if you can't get enough of Michael Lewis shirtless you should also check out this gallery.

entry.title: Interview ✫ "Fashion Star"
entry.content: An interview I did with Orly Shani, a contestant on NBC's "Fashion Star". I saw her clothes in H&M, so for me it qualifies as a full on celebrity.

entry.title: Reporting ✫ Versace Fashion Show
entry.content:
Had a great time covering the Versace fashion show for "Hadshot Habidur" (Israeli TV).
here is the full video article we did about the fashion show.
and here are some pictures I took at the scene:



more pictures can be found on my Facbook album
and here, again, a little video I took at the show

entry.title: Interview ✰ Matthew Broderick
entry.content:
Actor Matthew Broderick has been active for three decades now, and still I believe that his greatest wikipedia trivia is that he is Sara Jessica Parker's husband. oh, and "Ferris Bueller's Day Off" which was like a million years ago.

Anyway, I've interviewed Broderick for his new movie, "Tower Heist". saying "His" is sort of stretching it, since Broderick plays a minor rule and leave the center stage for Eddie Murphy and Ben Stiller. Nevertheless, he was a nice guy in reality and even offered me a job (being the doorman for his family, which means opening SJP door for her. hmm, tempting).

The full interview with Matthew Broderick can be found here

entry.title: Interview ✪ The "Ramzor" girls
entry.content:
Really hard working this month! here's another article I did with Yael Sharoni and Liat Har Lev, the female stars of the Israeli sitcom "Ramzor" (Traffic Light). It was on the cover of "Signon" magazine.

 

The interview with Yael Sharoni and Liat Har Lev

entry.title: Profile ✯ Rosie Huntington-Whiteley
entry.content: Rosie Huntington-Whiteley, one of the world's hottest models, in a profile I did for "At" magazine

entry.title: Interview ✯ Randy Harrison
entry.content:
I Still have fond memories from Randy Harrison who played Justin in the hit gay TV show "Queer as Folk". Last week I got a chance to interview him for "Rating" magazine prior to his trip to Israel.

Here it is

entry.title: Live Coverage ★ Eurovision Song Contest
entry.content:
Like every year, yesterday we covered the Eurovision contest LIVE for NRG.
Turned out really funny!

entry.title: Shooting ✰ "Three Days in Strange Houses"
entry.content:
when I was younger (18) I was invited to host a documentary movie called "Three days in strange Houses" for YTV, the (then) youth channel of Yes broadcasting. I remember it as a fun experience, traveling Israel for three days and meeting nice and interesting people.


While organizing my things I found the movie, now 10 years old, and uploaded it to the computer. here it is in its fullness - 40 something minutes long. nice memory :)

entry.title: Live Coverage ✰ The Academy Awards
entry.content: here is a live blogging I did during the 2011 Academy Awards, a.k.a "The Oscars". Overall, I can conclude and say that it was a pretty boring ceremony, with no surprises or drama. Don't think I'll do it for another year :)

entry.title: Interview ✪ David Duchovny ("Californication")
entry.content:
Here is a gorgeous interview I had with a gorgeous guy, David Duchovny from "Californication".
A little achievement: This was my first cover story for "Tarbut Ma'ariv". Nice.
✰ You can read the interview with David Duchovny for "Tarbut Ma'ariv" here

entry.title: academic-profile
entry.content:
NIM DVIR

New York | + 1-646-244-2338 | Nimrod.Dvir@gmail.com | American, German (EU) and Israeli citizen


About Me
‎Education
Information Science PhD (2015)
State University of New York, University at Albany, USA

Full Scholarship based on academic merit | Research Area: Online Behavior As Affected By Social Identities


Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.), Marketing and Information Systems (2014)
Zicklin School of Business, Baruch College (CUNY), USA

Graduated with Merit | Graduate Assistant at ZSB Research Center | Member of Zicklin Marketing & Media Association (ZiMMA) | currently completing a Professional Certificate in Web Development
Bachelor of Arts (B.A.), International Relations and Media Studies (2011)
New York University (NYU), USA

Graduated Cum Laude and on Dean’s List | Recipient of the Presidential Honor Scholarship
Matriculation certificate with honors, Computer Science, Mathematics and Robotics
The Herzliya Hebrew Gymnasium, Tel Aviv, Israel


Teaching and Research Experience
  • Graduate Research Assistant (2015-2016)
    • Working paper: Less is More: The Impact of Textual ‎Length on ‎Online ‎Compliance - An empirical investigation of design strategy affect persuasion and decision-making in web ‎based environment ‎
  • INF 108-0002: Programming for Problem Solving‎ (Undergraduate level‎) (2015-2016)
  • Special Topics: Content Strategy (Undergraduate level), new course preparation ‎(2015-2016)
  • Special Topics in CIS: Wordpress (Undergraduate level), new course preparation‎ (2015-2016)
  • Graduate Assistant, ZSB Research Center, Baruch College ‎‎(2014)‎
    • Worked as a Graduate Assistant at ZSB Research Center
    • Assisted with the preparation and implementation of research studies
    • Provided technical support for faculty and doctoral students
Work Experience
Development Manager (07/2014 - Present)
ClaimFame.com ¦ PorehOMG.com ¦  New York City, USA

- Cross-functional web operations and development leader in a venture-backed e-commerce startups
- Collaborate with internal and third-party teams, developers and clients to develop and launch innovative products such as video based e-learning services
- Increased user conversion rate by 70% using content optimization and SEO & SEM strategies
- Improved lead generation rate by 50%, lowered the cost per lead (CPL) by 300% and Gained 50,000 new members in a under year
- Promoted within 4 months from analyst to manager
Information Manager (09/2012 - 08/2014)
Young Judaea Global ¦ The Jewish Agency for Israel ¦ New York City, USA

- Developed and managed new customer and business relationship management (CRM & BRM) systems
- Defined requirements, data dictionaries, product roadmaps and marketing strategies for new digital services
- Increased adoption of SFDC customized platform by 100+ new internal users across the US and Canada
- Liaised “Israel Tech Challenge", a career development project for computer science Students
Senior Correspondent to New York (09/2011 - 08/2014)
Ynet (+800,000 daily views) ¦ Channel 10 (43.7% exposure rate) ¦ Yedioth (1,200,000 Daily Circulation)  ¦ New York City, USA

- Initiated and produced multimedia content and managed sections across integrated platforms (online, print, TV)
- Created highly successful viral video content (600,000+ views)
- Developed excellent written and verbal communications skills in Hebrew and English
Head of Editorial & Content  ¦ Content Strategist (03/2004 - 08/2011)
Ma’ariv Group (2nd Largest media group in Israel) ¦ Pnai Plus (Israel's largest entertainment magazine, +1M weekly circulation) ¦ Time Out Tel Aviv Magazine (+200,000 weekly circulation)  ¦ Tel Aviv, Israel

- Supervised a team of 50+ media professionals including writers, graphic designers and programmers
- Led transitioning from print to web and development of monetization and web operations strategies
- Promoted from reporter to culture & entertainment editor to head of content across all platforms
- Improved online traffic by 100% to 2M monthly unique users
- Increased weekly circulation of printed magazines by 200%
- Edited the top ten selling issues for 3 consecutive years
Intelligence Officer (03/2000 - 03/2004)
IDF - Israel Defense Forces

- Trained and served as a data analyst and project manager in an elite intelligence unit (8200)
- Built and maintained a designated website for intelligence purposes
- Managed data analysis of various intelligence resources
- cross-functional project management operations in a Hi-Tech environment


Achievements
New York University Presidential Honor Scholar
Awarded to students demonstrating superlative academic achievement, independent research and a record of leadership
Honorary Delegate to Tucson, AZ (USA)
Awarded to outstanding soldiers by The Jewish Agency and Israel Defense Forces
Tel Aviv Municipality Community Service Award
Awarded for volunteer work as a counselor and teacher in a non-profit organization for runaway, homeless and LGBT youth
Honorary Youth Ambassador to the Netherlands
Sent by The Israeli Ministry of Foreign Affairs as a delegate to the Netherlands to promote diplomatic relations
